intro: Chamaerhodiola euphorbioides, commonly known as the alpine cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm, with woody stems and alternate, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in cold, arid environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Chamaerhodiola euphorbioides is adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in high-altitude ecosystems.
